channel.title: INfinance
channel.description: This is a randomly ordered feed of the most recent entries from INfinance, skipping any feeds with errors.

item.title: Boot Barn stock slides after CEO departure announcement, but Western-wear retailer’s forecast is more upbeat
item.description: Western-themed retail chain Boot Barn Holdings Inc. on Monday said its chief executive would be leaving next month, while forecasting better sales and...

item.title: Ford sees another $1 billion EV loss, lowers guidance and its stock falls 6%
item.description: Ford Motor Co. reported earnings late Monday, but investors looked past a beat.

item.title: Oil Prices Slide After Israeli Strike Avoids Iranian Energy Facilities
item.description: U.S. oil futures fell 6.1% Monday, their steepest decline since 2022, after Israel’s strikes on Iran avoided energy facilities. All three major stock ...

item.title: Nikkei Slips 0.2%, Dragged by Electronics, Machinery Stocks
item.description: Japanese stocks were lower in early trade, dragged by falls in electronics and machinery stocks as domestic political uncertainty continues.

item.title: The WSJ Dollar Index Rises 0.09% to 99.05
item.description: The WSJ Dollar Index rose for the second-consecutive trading day, reaching the highest level since the end of July.

item.title: Apple Intelligence is key to new iPhone sales, but don’t expect a big revenue jolt right away
item.description: With Monday’s rollout of Apple Intelligence on Apple Inc.’s newest iPhones, investors need to remember that the addition of generative artificial inte...

item.title: Oil Gains Amid Middle East Tensions
item.description: Oil rose in early Asian trade, after falling recently as Israel steered clear of Iran’s oil and nuclear facilities in attacks over the weekend.

item.title: Gold Edges Higher; May Remain Rangebound Ahead of Key Econ
item.description: Gold edged higher in early Asian trade. Prices could trade within a narrow range before the release of key U.S. economic data, XS.com said.

item.title: Vans maker VF Corp. rallies 23% on results, and CEO says he feels good about Q3
item.description: Shares of VF Corp. rocketed higher after hours on Monday after the parent company of Vans and the North Face reported second-quarter results that beat...

item.title: How worried should stock-market investors be about a ‘lost decade’?
item.description: It’s theoretically possible that the stock market will play out a “Roaring ‘20s” scenario for the rest of this decade.
